text: Hi Everyone, am beginner and am working for a company who wants to sent email on HubSpot form submission. have done much things regarding it but I stuck in email template customization. is it possible to show a progress bar based on variable's values in email template ?

yeah, alrighty
more trying to hack my way around the css that’s already there
so with dnd templates I use the column class and thus existing responsive css gets applied

what do you suggest to do here then? :slightly_smiling_face:
<@UKGV272KS>

can someone please help me understand how to wrap an email so that the engagement is tracked in HubSpot?

_The email is sent from your system, but is wrapped with the HubSpot tracking codes that allow full engagement tracking and measurement, so you can see the performance within HubSpot. Tracking is associated to contact records based on email address._

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/transactional_email/smtpapi_overview>
Are you trying to send the email from somewhere else? Like gmail?
you can just use the bcc email address
and pass the username produced from the generate token?
I don't understand what you mean. What username and token?
i mean the username produced from the 'generate token' from email > stmp > generate token
so that username is what i pass as the BCC
You can get the email account by going to Settings > Objects > Activities > Email Logging
ok....so i was hoping for more analytics on how the user interacted with the email...is there a code snipped to include in the header to include more analytics?

I’m not sure what’s not working for you. You said previously using those classes worked. Perhaps screenshots of what you’re seeing would help?

Generally you can’t do much if at all code wise with the DnD editor. It’s not really meant for that, and meant for marketers that don’t know code. If you want more code control you need to code the emails.
